result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles D Garvens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Straight time. Sentence credit of 1 day was granted if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

No Violent contact with victim A. Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Comply with Domestic Violence Counseling through a State certified batterer's intervention program. 
No possession of dangerous weapons (e.g. Knives, Firearms, etc) 
Upon Petition - Court will consider early termination of probation at any point after 9 months, if all conditions are met and agent deems appropriate. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles D Garvens

defendant.name: Garvens, Charles D
defendant.address: 17614 W West Ln, New Berlin, WI 53146

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered and pre-trial offer.

10:40 AM Defendant Charles D Garvens in court.  Attorney Paul E Bucher in court for Charles D Garvens.  Prosecuting attorney Charles Patrick Hoffmann in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called for plea and sentencing.
Court places offer on the record.
Court conducts plea colloquy.

Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty. 
State and Defense make sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statement to the court.

Court orders the following:
IMPOSED AND STAYED: 

JAIL:  90 Days - Straight-time.
1  Day Credit.

TERM ON PROBATION:  18  MONTHS; 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
*Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
*No violent contact with:  Victim A; 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done;
*Domestic Violence Counseling through a State-certified batterer's intervention program; 
*No possession of dangerous weapons (e.g. knives, firearms, etc.)

COSTS:  $243
DOMESTIC VIOLENCE SURCHARGE: $100
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Upon Petition - Court will consider early termination of probation at any point after 9 months, if all conditions are met and agent deems appropriate.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A (or their residence)\ listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.   Defendant allowed one trip to the residence accompanied by a peace/police officer to obtain personal items.
